Articles.Content: I need one. videos or voice would be nice so I can learn more while I do my exercises near my computer.

There's usually a few Twitch accounts streaming that you can watch. I believe The_Lolbster and DasValdez both do somewhat educational streams once in a while. I'm usually too busy to catch them, but I hear they're good.

Edit: In fact, looks like Das just started streaming. http://www.twitch.tv/dasvaldez

Edited November 22, 2014 by Slam_Jones
typos
Yes, Das' show will start any moment now and it's his bootcamp stream, in which he teaches people the basics of KSP. He also does streams on many other (more advaced) topics.

A review of Delta V and the DeltaV map has made my eye stop twitching. I was having trouble with trial and error getting the ideal amount of fuel to take outside of kerbin system and it was stressing me out, that and my com network that overtime breaks

http://deltavmap.com/

You'll find the figures on the deltaV map here much more accurate, and you can use it for going between any planets/moons, not just a trip from Kerbin. There are several others available, the composite deltaV map by mhoram (IIRC) is particularly nice.

Have you checked The Drawing Board for all the hundreds of pages and thousands of hours of tutorials that are already available for KSP?
